Class KK_ServerApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • KK_ServerApp

  • public class KK_ServerApp
extends java.lang.Object
    KK_ServerApp is the application logic for the main KnockKnock application. This starts the KnockKnock application, sets up the listening port, the serverSockets for accepting the client connections and the application GUI object.
    Author:
    notroot

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KK_ServerApp(int port, KK_ServerAppGUI serverGUI)
      KK_ServerApp constructor that receive the port to listen to for connection as parameter in console

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void serverConnection()
      Sets up the socket connection for the application server, listens on port 4444
      void startKnockKnock()
      startKnockKnock() starts by setting listening tag to ensure the continuous while loop maintains a listening state for incoming connections

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • KK_ServerApp

        public KK_ServerApp(int port,
                    KK_ServerAppGUI serverGUI)
        KK_ServerApp constructor that receive the port to listen to for connection as parameter in console
        Parameters:
        port - server side listening TCP port
        serverGUI - setup serverGUI object with the connection logic

        public void startKnockKnock()
        startKnockKnock() starts by setting listening tag to ensure the continuous while loop maintains a listening state for incoming connections

                      throws java.io.IOException
        Sets up the socket connection for the application server, listens on port 4444
        Throws:
